etymologies: late 19th century. From German Rhodinal from rhodin- (in Rhodinol) + -al

definitions: A liquid aldehyde obtained by oxidation of rhodinol.

notes.text: Rhodinal is a mixture of the same isomers as citronellal but with the isomers in analogous proportions to those in rhodinol. Formula: C₁₀H₁₈O.
